newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: NatSteel in talks with Brazil's Acominas.
newsitem.headline: NatSteel in talks with Brazil's Acominas.

text.p: Singapore's NatSteel said on Saturday it was part of a consortium holding talks on taking an equity stake in Brazil's Aco Minas Gerais S.A. (Acominas).
A statement from the company said that a news agency report saying Acominas was discussing the sale of a $500 million stake to NatSteel was inaccurate, however.
The statement said that the figure referred to Acominas' planned capital projects stretched over a number of years.
"The equity required in the initial two years will be substantially lower," the statement said.
"In any event, if the discussions should lead to an eventual investment to acquire equity interest in Acominas, NatSteel plans to do so with a consortium of strategic partners," it said.
"NatSteel wishes to emphasise that the discussions are in the preliminary stage and no commitment has been made," the statement added. It gave no further details.
